# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
# Function to wrap string with line breaks
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text) # Split into individual words

    wrapped_text = ""
    for i in eachindex(words)
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(words[i]) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n" # Add newline
        end
        wrapped_text *= words[i] # Append current word
    end
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped with line breaks when the text width exceeds 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function takes a string and a maximum text width as input. It iterates over each word in the text and adds a newline whenever the cumulative length of the wrapped text plus the current word's length exceeds the given text width.

The example provided a long sentence that gets wrapped with line breaks when necessary, demonstrating how the `wrap_string` function works.
